intro: Earina floripecten, commonly known as the flame flower, is a striking plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, brightly colored inflorescences that resemble flames, typically in shades of red and orange. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a waxy texture. Earina floripecten is primarily found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of New Caledonia.
